result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary A Staggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-No Contact with Wal-mart or their premises.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
2:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-No Contact with Wal-mart or their premises.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

10:49 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer but needs to discuss with the defendant.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 26, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:50 a.m.

1:42 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received Discovery and needs to review it.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on March 8, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:43 p.m.

9:37 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant qualifies for PD representation and will be representing her.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 5, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:37 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to go to the Berlin Walmart.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to go to the Berlin Walmart.

Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to go to the Berlin Walmart.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 1, 2015 at 9:125 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:14 a.m.
